Fanatical's latest huge sale on PC games is live now. If you want to stock up on AAA titles and indie hits without breaking the bank, make sure to check out Fanatical's Level Up Sale before it ends on April 27.

If you spend $15 or more on a single transaction, you'll get to pick a free Steam key from a list of 10 games that includes Teslagrad Remastered, Mindustry, Alex Kidd in Miracle World DX, and other well-received indies. If none of the freebies are of interest, you can roll the dice with a mystery game or secure a $1 coupon.

Some notable deals worth checking out include the Mortal Kombat 1: Khaos Reigns Kollection for $25.64, which is a big discount from its normal $90 price. This includes the Mortal Kombat 1 base game, the Khaos Reins story expansion, five Kameo fighters, the Jean-Claude Van Damme skin for Johnny Cage, and the Kombat Pack 1 and 2 that add multiple DLC characters.

Several newer titles are also on sale during the event, including Monster Hunter Wilds for $56 (was $70), Indiana Jones and the Great Circle for $48.29 (was $70), and Kingdom Come: Deliverance II for $51 (was $60).

If you're working with a tight budget, there are plenty of games discounted to under $10, like the Batman: Arkham Collection that includes Batman: Arkham Asylum, Arkham City, and Arkham Knight for $7.49 (was $60). Other low-price deals include RoboCop: Rogue City for $7.24 (normally $50), Dave the Diver for $9 (was $20), and Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night for $5 for $5 (down from $40), to name a few.

The sale can also save you a few dollars on preorders of select upcoming titles. Capcom Fighting Collection 2 is down to just $32.79 (was $40) ahead of its May 15 release, while the Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Digital Deluxe Edition, which releases August 26, is available for $60 (was $80).

Hundreds of other great PC games are discounted in Fanatical's Level Up Sale. You'll find a list of some of our favorite deals below, and you can browse the full selection over at Fanatical. All games purchased in the sale are delivered as official keys. Most can be redeemed on Steam, though some may be for other platforms like the Epic Game Store.

The Level Up Sale isn't the only way to save on PC games at Fanatical. The retailer also has numerous bundle deals worth checking out, like the Warhammer 40,000 Battles Build Your Own Bundle, the Build Your Own Play On The Go Elite Bundle, the Oddworld Complete Collection, and the April 2025 Platinum Collection. There are also bundle deals on comics like the Mass Effect Comics & Art Book Bundle that includes 11 graphic novels and art books for $9, or the Dungeon Crawl Classics Lankhmar RPG Collection that includes up to 24 5E-compatible TTRPG adventure modules for $13.

item.title: Four New Limited-Edition Fortnite Controllers With Stylish Designs Are Up For Grabs
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/four-new-limited-edition-fortnite-controllers-with-stylish-designs-are-up-for-grabs/1100-6530952/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

CRKD just launched new Fortnite-themed limited editions of its excellent Nitro Deck and Nitro Deck+ Nintendo Switch grips and Neo S wireless controllers, and like other official Fortnite accessories, each one includes codes to unlock bonus in-game cosmetics. The standouts of the quartet of new devices are the Nitro Deck and Nitro Deck+ models, which adorn our favorite Switch premium handheld controllers with exclusive Fortnite-themed skins. There are also two new variants of the Neo S Wireless controller for Switch, PC, and mobile that feature the Fortnite characters Peely and Raven. All four controllers are available now at Amazon.

Nitro Deck+ Renegade Raider Fortnite Edition

$80

This limited edition version of the Nitro Deck+ features a unique color scheme and pattern based on the Fortnite character Renegade Raider, and comes with a code to unlock the O.G. Glider skin in the game.

As mentioned earlier, the Nitro Deck+ is our favorite premium Switch handheld controller. While it works great as a grip and gamepad, it even works as its own dock, supporting charging and USB-C video passthrough. It's equipped with anti-drift Hall Effect thumbsticks, six programmable buttons (four on the back and two on the sides), and a kickstand.

The Nitro Deck+ Renegade Raider Fortnite Edition is a great option for Fortnite fans who want to show off their love for the game, but it's worth noting this new device $80, which is $10 more than most other Nitro Deck+ models. We've listed a few more Nitro Deck+ deals below in case you're interested in shopping around.

More Nitro Deck+ Nintendo Switch Controller Deals:

  • Clear Black -- $60 ($70)
  • Clear White -- $60 ($70)
  • Clear Black with HDMI Adapter -- $70 ($80)
  • Clear White with HDMI Adapter -- $70 ($80)

Nitro Deck Cuddle Team Leader Fortnite Edition

$60

CRKD also has a new Fortnite-themed version of its standard Nitro Deck controller. The color scheme for this one is based on the Cuddle Team Leader, and it includes a code for the Cuddle Cruiser Glider in-game item.

The standard Nitro Deck model is very close in design and functionality to the Nitro Deck+, but with a few key differences, like no USB-C video passthrough and no sidekick buttons. It also features an offset thumbstick layout instead of the parallel placement like on the Nitro Deck+, though it still uses Hall Effect sticks.

The Nitro Deck Cuddle Team Leader Fortnite Edition is available for $60 at Amazon. Just like with the new Fortnite Edition Nitro Deck+, that's $10 more expensive than the $50 other color options sell for, so we've included a list of other models in case you're curious about what else is available.

More Nitro Deck Controllers:

  • GameCube-themed purple controller bundle -- $50 ($80)
  • Retro Mint controller bundle -- $50 ($80)
  • Crystal Pink controller bundle -- $50 ($80)
  • Orange Zest controller bundle -- $50 ($80)

Neo S Raven Fortnite Edition Wireless Controller with Charging Dock

$60

CRKD's Neo S Wireless Controller is a compact, rectangular gamepad featuring all the standard buttons, D-pad, and thumbsticks you'd expect from other controllers, plus two extra back buttons. It also uses Hall Effect thumbsticks and triggers, and supports Bluetooth connectivity on Switch, mobile, and PC--including handhelds like Steam Deck, the ROG Ally, and Lenovo Legion Go. This model sports a purple and blue color scheme and decals based on the Raven character from Fortnite and includes a charging dock and a code for the Viceroy Mark I Glider in-game item.

While all four of these Fortnite-themed CRKD controllers are in stock and available, it's worth noting these are limited-edition accessories and could sell out fast.

If you're looking to complete your collection, CRKD also launched a Fortnite Festival Edition of the Neo S controller with a unique purple color scheme that includes a detachable 5-fret module to use in Fortnite's Guitar Hero-like Festival mode. It's available at Amazon for $60. The company is also launching a line of Gibson Les Paul guitar controllers on June 27, and while they're not specifically Fortnite-themed, they're designed to be used with Festival mode. Preorders are available at Amazon.

If you're interested in picking up a Fortnite-themed controller for PS5 (and PC), PlayStation's Fortnite Limited Edition DualSense is available once again for $85 at Amazon and Walmart.

item.title: Mario Kart World Switch 2 Bundle Will Be Discontinued This Fall
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/mario-kart-world-switch-2-bundle-will-be-discontinued-this-fall/1100-6530950/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

During this week's Mario Kart World-focused livestream, Nintendo reiterated an important fact about the Switch 2 console bundle that comes with the game: It will only be available until Fall 2025. Nintendo originally announced the bundle's limited availability during the Switch 2 Direct earlier this month, but with preorder delays and controversy around game prices, this key detail has flown a bit under the radar.

Nintendo hasn't announced a firm cutoff date for the launch bundle, but the Fall 2025 stopping point for manufacturing could mean the bundle won't be on store shelves this holiday season. Granted, it's very possible that it will be a challenge to find the Switch 2, bundle or not, on store shelves in the US this year. Stock availability concerns have only increased in recent weeks due to the Trump administration's new tariffs.

Outside of reconfirming the limited availability for the bundle, Nintendo's 15-minute Mario Kart World livestream stayed clear of the Switch 2 console itself. We still don't know when console preorders will be available in the US and Canada, but Nintendo unveiled several exciting details about Mario Kart World, including the return of Battle Mode and an in-depth look at the new costume and meal systems.

Mario Kart World launches exclusively on Nintendo Switch 2 on June 5, the same day as the console.

item.title: Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3: Start Date, Star Wars Battle Pass, And Everything Else To Know
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-chapter-6-season-3-start-date-star-wars-battle-pass-and-everything-else-to-know/1100-6530938/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

There's just a few weeks remaining in Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 2, and it's increasingly looking like next season is going to represent a major change from the typical summer Fortnite schedule. Normally, the spring Fortnite season would run until late May or early June, but Season 2 is wrapping up weeks earlier. But there's a very big reason for the change--more on that in a moment.

Even as we wait for Season 3, there's still some work to be done before we get there. The final part of Season 2's storyline quests is now active, and they'll lead us into another end-of-season story event like the titanic battle between Shogun X and Daigo we had in Season 1.

Once that's done, it'll be full speed ahead toward Season 3, which reportedly has a theme that's going to get a whole lot of folks excited. Let's take a look at what we know so far.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Fortnite Star Wars Season start date
  • Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3 theme
  • Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3 reveal event
  • Fortnite Star Wars season battle pass
  • New Fortnite Star Wars skins
  • Lego Fortnite Star Wars updates in Chapter 6 Season 3

Fortnite Star Wars Season start date

The current battle pass is advertised to end on May 2 at 10:30 PM PT / 1:30 AM ET, which means the plan is for Fortnite to go offline at that time for maintenance and the season update. If all goes well, the new season will kick off during the morning of Friday, May 2.

Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3 theme

All signs indicate that Season 3 will be a Star Wars-focused season, which will add Star Wars locations, weapons, and items to battle royale, like last year's Marvel-oriented Absolute Doom season. But it seems as though Epic has learned some important lessons from the way the last Marvel season wore out its welcome so hard that the company had to pull most of the Marvel items from battle royale before the season ended--this Star Wars season will reportedly last just a month. Short and sweet.

Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3 reveal event

Epic has advertised a big announcement regarding Fortnite x Star Wars during Star Wars Celebration in Japan this weekend, promising some big news will be announced on the livestream on the Star Wars YouTube page on Saturday, April 19. Given the rampant rumors, it's expected that this is when the upcoming Star Wars season will be officially announced. It's unlikely we'll get a full battle pass reveal, since Epic usually likes to promote that stuff within a day or two of the season launch, but some sort of teaser is obviously happening.

Fortnite Star Wars season battle pass

A Star Wars-themed season would mean a Star Wars-themed battle pass, but none of the skins have leaked yet. There are rumors and guesses based on code names, like Qui-Gon and C-3PO, but nothing real just yet.

Given that the season is expected to last just a month, it's likely the battle pass will be shortened as well--the 30-day OG and Remix passes included just four skins instead of eight. But it could be that this Star Wars pass will have five skins.

New Fortnite Star Wars skins

While a Star Wars season would obviously include Star Wars skins on its battle pass, we'd also expect to see some new stuff in the shop, too. There are rumors of skins based on C-3PO, Qui-Gon Jinn, Palpatine, and General Grievous, but those seem to be more like guesswork than true leaks, and it's also not clear, if the rumors are true, whether these would be in the battle pass or in the shop.

Lego Fortnite Star Wars updates in Chapter 6 Season 3

We haven't had any leaks about Star Wars-themed Lego Fortnite updates, but the current Lego Pass also ends on May 2. If Star Wars season is indeed arriving in battle royale that day, it stands to reason the same thing will happen in Lego Fortnite Odyssey. Last year's Lego Pass (pictured above) included a Chewbacca skin and ushered in a major Star Wars storyline, and so it seems safe to assume that the next Lego Pass will include another Star Wars person, and that the Galactic Civil War will once again intrude upon your Lego Fortnite islands.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure's Fruitful Friendship Update Gives The Game A Medieval Spin
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/hello-kitty-island-adventures-fruitful-friendship-update-gives-the-game-a-medieval-spin/1100-6530949/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure's latest seasonal content drop--the Fruitful Friendship update--is available now on Apple Arcade.

Starting on April 18, players can join Kitty White, Kuromi, My Melody, and the rest of the Sanrio crew in the Imagination Celebration, a medieval-themed limited-time event complete with princess dresses, suits of armor, wizard robes, and castle-worthy furniture. Players must help Hello Kitty & Co. collect Mystic Stones to restore magic to the Kingdom of Friendship. The Imagination Celebration Event ends on May 22.

But the Fruitful Friendship update has plenty more in store. It also includes a new feature in which players help Keroppi plant and maintain an orchard located on City Town's rooftops, allowing players to grow 13 new fruits. These new fruits can then be used to concoct new types of Fruit Sandos in the Imagination Cafe.

The update also includes a City Town newcomer and new visitor quests. Players can help decorate a cabin to serve as a home for Retsuko's new friend, Puko, and new quests for pre-existing City Town visitors have also been added.

Lastly, Fruitful Friendship is introducing a number of player-requested quality-of-life improvements, like a map to help players navigate City Town's Sewers and an updated tool wheel.

But even more seasonal content is on the way, according to developer Sunblink Entertainment, which directed players to "prepare for an egg-cellent island takeover of an iconic Sanrio pal." The developer added that "Players can look forward to exciting content update coming soon."

Hello Kitty Island Adventure is available to play via Apple Arcade, PC (via Steam), and Nintendo Switch.
